result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa Carol Sukowatey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Melissa Carol Sukowatey is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Melissa Carol Sukowatey was found guilty of Obtain Prescription Drug w/ Fraud [Modifiers: Penalty-Fraud/Obtaining Prescriptions], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court converts into a civil judgment.
Court waives DNA surcharge.
Huber granted for work or child care.
Court will not order a DNA sample.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Minot. DA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Melissa Carol Sukowatey appeared from jail. Case called at 9:36 am. Court reviews file. DA Nieskes updates the court. Atty Harrelson makes statement. Court revokes agreement and enters conviction. Atty Harrelson makes recommendations. Def makes statement.  Court orders: 30 Days jail. Credit for 8 days. Huber for work or child care. Court orders: Court Costs $243.00. To be converted to a civil judgment. Does not includes DNA Surcharge or Sample. km
Atty Harrelson. hml
Sentencing hearing on June 9, 2017 at 09:30 am.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CM82, 16CM794 and 17CM182:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. DA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Melissa Carol Sukowatey appeared. Case called at 10:38 a.m. Court notes these matters are set for a plea and sentencing hearing. DA Nieskes recites agreement. State has complied with Victims Rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to  amended Ct 2 Disorderly Conduct without the domestic abuse enhancer in 16CM794 and Ct. 3 Misd. Bail Jumping. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 2 Disorderly Conduct in 16CM794 and Ct. 3 Bail Jumping in 16CM794. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct's 1, 4 & 5 in 16CM794 and file 17CM182. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. 20 days to file appeal. Schedule 15CM82 with Branch 3.

Crt orders:

In Ct. 2 Disorderly Conduct:

- S/W 1 years probation. Report to probation no later than 2:00 p.m. 

- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

- DNA Sample and $200.00 Surcharge. Any bond on file to apply. Remainder to be paid over the course of probation.

- Court costs of $243.00

-  AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Josh Sneft.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person. Contact only for child custody purposes only.  

In Ct. 3 Bail Jumping:

- - S/W 1 years probation. Report to probation no later than 2:00 p.m. To run concurrent to Count 1

- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

- DNA Sample and $200.00 Surcharge. Any bond on file to apply. Remainder to be paid over the course of probation.

- Court costs of $243.00

-  AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Josh Sneft.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person. Contact only for child custody purposes only.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CM82, 16CM794 and 17CM182:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. DA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Melissa Carol Sukowatey appeared. Case called at 2:54 p.m. Court notes these matters are set for a pre trial conference. Atty Harrelson states close to a resolution. Requesting another pre trial conference. Atty Harrelson would like to be heard on bond. DE would like the condition to reside with mother be removed. DA Nieskes gives argument. DE does not have another residence at this time. Court will deny request to modify bond at this time. Needs a new address.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 5, 2017 at 10:30 am.

$350.00 bond on file.

Comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Day Report Center agreement.

Defendant to reside at her mother's address on Highview.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing pursuant to the Day Report Center protocols. If UA testing is required, the same shall be viewed in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex. Additional testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  John V.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Pre-trial conference on April 19, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 16CM794 and 15CM82:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle DA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Melissa Carol Sukowatey appeared. Case called at 9:39 a.m. Court notes 16CM794 is set for a Motion Hearing regarding Motion to Suppress Statements and Evidence filed by Atty Harrelson. State calls Chief Sirovatka to the stand. S/T Tom Sirovatka. Employed as Chief of Police for the Village of Somerset. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. Record reflects identification. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Witness excused. State calls Officer Farrell to the stand. S/T John Farrell. Employed as an Officer with the Village of Somerset. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. Direct by DA Nieskes. PL Exhibit #1 (miranda rights form). O/R Exhibit #1. Cross by Atty Harrelson. DE Exhibit #3 (Probable Cause Statement). O/R Exhibit #3. Witness excused. State recalls Chief Sirovatka. Direct by DA Nieskes. PL Exhibit #2 (DE written narative statement). Cross by Atty Harrelson. Atty Harrelson makes statement. State will not contest statement made to Deputy VanSommeren. Atty Harrelson calls Melissa S. to the stand. S/T Melissa S. Direct by Atty Harrelson. Cross by DA Nieskes. Redirect by Atty Harrelson. Witness excused. DA Nieskes gives argument. Atty Harrelson gives argument. Rebutal by DA Nieskes. Requesting court to deny the motion. Court will suppress the third statement only to Officer VanSommeren. Court will issue a written decision. State moves to amend bonds to reflect the day report center protocol. Atty Harrelson gives argument. Court will note objection. Court will amend bond.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 19, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

* AMENDED *

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing pursuant to the Day Report Center protocols. If UA testing is required, the same shall be viewed in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex. Additional testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-  Comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Day Report Center agreement.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Family Fresh or County Market Stores in Hudson WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Maintain stable employment. 

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Pre-trial conference on March 22, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Angela Raye Olson   DF:  Melissa Carol Sukowatey appeared. Case called at 11:41. ADA McKinley updates the court and makes recommendation. There is a written edit on #9 in the diversion. Compass has been completed.  Atty. Olson agrees to recommendation. There is a diversion agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2,3 and 4. Atty's make statements. Crt signs 1 year diversion agreement. Diversion coordinator will present the court with quarterly updates. If DE completes all conditions in the diversion agreement the court will dismiss at the completion. DE to continue to make payments for Atty's fees.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton,  DF:  Melissa Carol Sukowatey appeared from jail. Court confirms address.
